note.p: Birth: Marton, Cleveland, England (27 October 1728)
Death: Kealakekua Bay, Hawaii (14 February 1779)
Research Field: Maritime discovery; mathematics; astronomy

Career: After a short time in a haberdashers shop in Staithes, he was apprenticed to Whitby shipowners and spent several years serving as a merchant seaman, primarily in the North Sea. Joined Royal Navy (1755), became a Master (1759); conveyed the expeditions of Daniel Solander and Joseph Banks; in New Zealand on occasions (between 1769 and 1777); departed Plymouth in search of Northwest Passage (1776)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 29/02/1776
Medals/Prizes: Copley Medal 1776
